commit 9f0ee897a491a21eedf40e4f72082395a73095c9
Author: Dmitry Batrak <Dmitry.Batrak@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 1 15:27:08 2021 +0300

    fix update of 'persistent' highlighters on document changes
    
    There exist two problems now with 'persistent' highlighters, both related to storing of line number as a field in PersistentRangeHighlighterImpl:
    1) That field isn't updated on document change happening far from current highlighter location. Such a change leaves the line number out of sync
       with actual highlighter location (defined by its offsets), and another update, performed via diff mechanism (e.g. for a whole text replacement)
       might reposition the highlighter incorrectly.
    2) For document changes in the vicinity of highlighter that field is updated only for one highlighter in a tree node (if there are several persistent
       highlighters with identical position and flags). If that highlighter is disposed, other highlighters might be updated incorrectly later,
       as the line number is out of sync for them.
    
    The described problems are fixed by not storing line number with the highlighter - its value can be restored from the document event when needed.
    This requires parsing of old document content, but it's done anyway to build the diff of changes used for highlighter update.
    
    hopefully, this will fix EA-257554 (T: ErrorStripeMarkerImpl.validateState)
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 04e19da35a0c6ee948da4ca11f72b560d9449778

commit 6369c4ea08a0fc53ff1d217cf67b25a0a03ca427
Author: Nikita Eshkeev <nikita.eshkeev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 30 01:26:52 2021 +0300

    EA-249917 Use NonBlocking read actions
    
    AbstractLayoutCodeProcessor's children use to have long read operations
    for processors to prepare the write task, which led to freezes. This
    patch employs ReadAction#nonBlocking to prepare the same write tasks,
    but it executes the read tasks synchronously.
    
    Signed-off-by: Nikita Eshkeev <nikita.eshkeev@jetbrains.com>
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: aa57bf778747a667a6a562544e0cfb0e27862d56

commit 4f51457608f6ffba82297f172f4750effc8d8642
Author: Nikolay Chashnikov <Nikolay.Chashnikov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 12 16:31:05 2021 +0300

    [project structure dialog] fix editing dependencies after pressing 'Apply' (IDEA-264113, EA-253839)
    
    Items from the table model may be used for modifications, so we need to take them from a modifiable model. If the table is updated inside 'rootsChanged' synchronously, it will cause problems because the new modifiable model will be created in the middle of ModulesConfigurator.apply, postponing via 'invokeLater' fixes the problem.

    PY-34444 EA-209323 Protect against corrupted pypi-cache.json, report write failures
    
    For some reason, it gets truncated sometimes and then malformed JSON file is
    constantly re-read, causing exceptions all over the place. Now, whenever

commit 14d6ae1b03ff7b8ddabd7057e09ec1a1528a3f37
Author: Tagir Valeev <Tagir.Valeev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 25 12:42:52 2021 +0700

    [java-dfa] Remove incorrect range-narrowing in ModRange.plus
    
    If we overflow and myMod is not a power of 2, we cannot rotate remainders: overflowed subrange may have different remainders. E.g. floorMod(Integer.MAX_VALUE, 6) = 1 but floorMod(Integer.MAX_VALUE+1, 6) = 4, not 2.
    Better algorithm is possible if we initially split our range at overflow point, then perform addition separately but for now let's just produce a correct result
    Fixes EA-257681 - IAE: LongRangeSet$Range.<init>
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 45a3a870ae238800386b6ce739694f8f847e6340

commit 4f4d3aa6240f9287a3024701dba6d7181cf0f418
Author: Vladimir Lagunov <vladimir.lagunov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 19 18:21:54 2021 +0700

    Don't store components of EditorEmbeddedComponentManager in a tree.
    
    It didn't work as expected anyway: sometimes components were unordered by the Y position. Also it caused issues like EA-255847.
    
    Now components are traversed with O(N). Although it worth than O(logN), RepaintManager still visits all components on validation, so in summary the complexity is always linear. And it's still by far better than O(N^2).
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: abbd78002862dbbd6c863177dcffaaa55b73a145

    EA-254339 - T: DataManagerImpl$MyDataContext.getData
    
    The easiest way to fix is employed: reset the eventCount.
    Alternatives:
    1. Use restricted precached data-context (not applicable, producers can use any data). Deeper down the code, ExecutionEnvironment does exactly that in its "CachingDataContext".

    3. add eventCount-based data-context refresh logic to `ConfigurationFromContext.getDataContext`.

commit 347d4ff0f83765c388a2b9089d6981c443150daa
Author: Dmitry Batrak <Dmitry.Batrak@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Tue Dec 29 18:37:52 2020 +0300

    fix inconsistency in updating highlighter offsets on document changes
    
    Highlighters kept in the same node of highlighter tree are expected to react identically on a document change.
    This is not the case for 'normal' and 'persistent' highlighters, so they should be kept in different nodes.
    
    hopefully this will fix EA-238161 (T: ErrorStripeMarkersModel$HighlighterIterator.advance)
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 1230713503ba72c94b1b188bf6b17dd6fffc4098

commit 6a1a76842eec45fcc0f76ffa119996630be5a85c
Author: Tagir Valeev <Tagir.Valeev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 18 13:21:10 2020 +0700

    [java-refactoring] VariableExtractor: try to fix introduced variable surroundings
    
    If the source file is heavily broken, after variable introduction it's possible that reparsed PSI won't contain the variable at all, so smart pointer cannot be dereferenced.
    Also, report an exception if the variable was introduced but we failed to dereference the smart pointer. Returning null in this case produces more harm than good: we are going into the non-inplace branch and try to refactor again, but the original expression to extract is gone anyway, so we will have completely unrelated problem later.
    Should fix EA-233989 - [ExtractVar] assert: IntroduceVariableBase$IntroduceVariablePass.introduce (unless it could be caused by another code path)
    Found by property tests!
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: f456086c2274c2c79208685493a061adfb5eb647

    editor optimisation: don't invalidate editor size when highlighter only changing text color is added/removed/updated
    
    changing text color can theoretically change text layout (e.g. by creating or breaking a ligature), but we'll neglect this effect
    (speaking of ligatures, the ones in popular fonts usually don't change text width, so they shouldn't cause a problem)

Date:   Tue Nov 17 15:04:40 2020 +0300

    [workspace model] make instances of OrderEntry survive after changes in ModifiableRootModelBridgeImpl (IDEA-255223, EA-237923)
    
    It may happen that a client stores an instance returned from ModifiableRootModel::getOrderEntries and call some setters on it after changing list of order entries. We have such code at least in "Copy to module libraries" action and in Dependencies table in Project Structure dialog, there may be more cases in plugins. Before this commit such code may fail because OrderEntryBridge will use the original index of the entry to modify data in ModuleEntity.
    
     In order to fix this we need to keep instances returned from 'getOrderEntries' and update indices in them when list of order entries changes, it's done via ModifiableRootModelBridgeImpl::mutableOrderEntries. RootModelBridgeImpl snapshot isn't used to retrieve information related to order entries, it's still used for content and source roots though.
    
     This change also removes unnecessary properties from OrderEntriesBridge's implementation which store information which may be taken from 'item' property instead.
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: deaeb7d1da42f7d398877885b8cbc250b2764af6

commit df5d73339cd953ffc3a87b78ba06f18298f7c9d1
Author: Tagir Valeev <Tagir.Valeev@jetbrains.com>

commit 6f1011db1ff4d286015b459cdd4ab64d7cb118d3
Author: Aleksey Pivovarov <AMPivovarov@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Oct 8 17:48:16 2020 +0300

    vcs: do not fire update callbacks after component disposal
    
    MergingUpdateQueue will execute pending update after its disposal.
    Wrap task into DisposableUpdate that will abort itself in this case.

commit a4c711c761442a9d149710d1372246659b180ad1
Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 30 13:30:55 2020 +0300

    EA-238869 PY-43773 Make PyPackageManager automatically dispose with its SDK
    
    It removes the risky layer of indirection when it's the responsibility of
    PyPackageManagers to remove PyPackageManager instance on disposal of its SDK
    and trigger its disposal. This logic still remains in case we create several
    package managers for the same not-yet-disposed SDK in PyPackageManagers, but,
    on the whole, it seems safer to dispose the manager as soon as its SDK becomes
    invalid, not relying on any mediator for that.
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 9d3f76d2ab03cc529c7f40e017d5f860fa713e1e

commit c7e61fd89c2afc4ac42dd7c8244029b5d87e0bf2
Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 30 13:24:20 2020 +0300

    EA-238869 PY-43773 Remove the cached package manager when its SDK is disposed
    
    Removing it also releases manager's own resources, namely VFS listeners,
    tracking packaging-related changes, expecting a valid SDK to query its paths.
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: f6109bb68ae242cf2f3a82abe4a51d84d440e7ed

commit c5b6b89ebd28c76ca892f9d1b708a9753aac7c39
Author: Nikita Eshkeev <nikita.eshkeev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 2 16:35:07 2020 +0300

    [openapi] EA-237806 IAE: Internals.checkLength
    
    ErrorPaneConfigurable used to call StreamEx.zip to build a stream of errors with their indices which internally checks if both indices and errors are of the same size and if not an exception occurs. ErrorPaneConfigurable limits the number of errors to be shown on the panel which caused the problem. Now the call to StreamEx.zip is replaced with StreamEx.of(errors).zipWith which doesn't complain of the streams are of different size and ends when one of the streams ends.
    
    Signed-off-by: Nikita Eshkeev <nikita.eshkeev@jetbrains.com>
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 6aa5f34c8c37b79c67636d03a1f760f3ff6dfaeb

commit fadb13158273343381358c9383f91d2f49dbe37d
Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Tue Jun 30 20:46:10 2020 +0300

    EA-232631 Disable f-string-like completion in strings nodes outside of a string literal
    
    String nodes are recognized by the lexer and, thus, can still appear even in
    syntactic contexts where an expression is not expected. In these cases the parser
    might wrap them in a PsiErrorElement instead of a PyStringLiteralExpression causing
    the reported CCE.
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 161d88d6307e028ede462f707f01320df2169747

commit 5f99c8c5162d47a6b8d5e4cb3999b18373ee1ae8
Author: Peter Gromov <peter@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu Jun 25 11:22:01 2020 +0200

    EA-209911 - assert: AbstractFileViewProvider.registerAsCopy: really check for cycles
    
    Setting an original file for a file with existing copies appears to be a valid scenario.
    
    For example, a completion is invoked in an empty literal where there's no injection, but there is one in the completion copy. Completion contributor copies the copy itself for some reason. Then a character is inserted into the very original document, so that there's no injection there as well. Another completion reuses the injection from the copy but now sets an original file for it.
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 472f6b8d73929dc2c596822b21f136f8d1ed92e2

commit 41a80efe0cca407ecb70061bde4818122f214a05
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Jun 1 10:12:34 2020 +0300

    [file-history] update diff preview later to get the correct selection
    
    When GraphTableModel is assigned a new visible pack, it calls fireTableDataChanged to notify data change. One of the listeners that get notified is JTable.tableChanged, which, among other things, clears selection, as it may be inconsistent with the new data. VcsLogGraphTable.updateDataPack restores selection after this happens.
    
    Among other listeners, fireTableDataChanged triggers diff preview update. As AbstractTableModel.fireTableChanged iterates listeners last to first, diff preview update is called when selection is yet to be updated, so it ends up with a selection inconsistent with the new visible pack. This commit updates diff preview in an invokeLater section, so it could get the restored selection.
    
    EA-220843
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 0de426d3ab50c27f3abd6cc27b3eabecb4bcab8b

commit f408a13c5791d066a62bf82d379263b5465e8a44

commit cc311ec931a373fcabbcc0003e44b03dd61ab6b9
Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Sat Apr 11 17:39:56 2020 +0300

    PY-30282 EA-209938 Don't render Python docstrings in external process under read action
    
    The helper script for rendering it is now launched synchronously in a pooled
    thread while the origin thread holding the read-write lock is constantly
    checking whether it was cancelled by incoming write action. If it was, it
    terminates preliminary and later rescheduled again thanks to the capabilities
    of NonBlockingReadAction. The pooled thread meanwhile will keep running waiting
    for the output of the script (up to 5 seconds timeout). Normally it shouldn't
    happen, though, and at least Quick Documentation no longer affects the editor
    responsiveness. It's a workaround for the current platform API limitation
    that queries ordinary documentation providers under read action with no way to
    opt out.
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: f74e67d67381326ce7685ff5fa31d42bffacb8be

commit c46c556166f85e3eaca18524759b47ba438d0db9
Author: Alexey Kudravtsev <cdr@intellij.com>

commit 2c48ac20ecfd2c86efdae328863526734964a5cd
Author: Aleksey Pivovarov <AMPivovarov@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 20 19:47:07 2020 +0300

    vcs: fix deadlock in AllVcses
    
    We can take myLock while holding WriteLock in 'AllVcses.dispose'.
    Thus, we should never take ReadLock while holding myLock.
    Thus, 'registerVcs'/'unregisterVcs' should be called while holding ReadLock or WriteLock,
    as we have no control over their implementation (that might load new services, 4ex).
    
    EA-231290 - F: DefaultProjectTimed.get
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: cb44f13663258e5d29ef2dcfb93b08f451dd3052

commit a10863f08bdf54e4be22df0cd69a90ec1e0cafba
Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 13 17:17:30 2020 +0300

    PY-41148 EA-131751 PythonDocumentationLinkProvider fetches documentation only for URLs it's responsible for
    
    Previously PyStdlibDocumentationLinkProvider used to request documentation for
    *any* symbol for which we had a configured external documentation URL. Not only
    performing numerous unnecessary network requests, it could also cause rendering
    of huge HTML chunks of unrelated documentation hanging up EDT. Extracting fragments
    from the stdlib documentation in PyStdlibDocumentationLinkProvider needs to be
    refined too, though.
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 2a826f6e9cb97d1a534c6990fb34696308fc9659

    [symbol] EA-229916 don't log error if declaring element file differs from identifying element file
    
    Some evaluators may have `TargetElementEvaluator.getNamedElement(leaf)` return element from another file other than

    range of the leaf without logging an error.

commit 3e93352d6bc116ca9d5ac44f6f8a76933863ece0
Author: Eugene Petrenko <eugene.petrenko@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Mar 21 19:26:04 2020 +0100

    EA-220456 - do not search for SDKs from EDT (spoil - we almost do not)
    
    ensure
    SdkType#suggestHomePath does not do any heavy operations (it is used to show the file chooser dialog)
    
    In fact, we use SdkType#suggestHomePaths for most of the cases, and it is called from a background thread.
    
    This commit fixes the delegation - it is only allowed for the SdkType#suggestHomePaths to call the SdkType#suggestHomePath, not the opposite order. There were several cases of opposite delegation.
    
    Also related to PY-41218
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: d5716e81a35d33368812689eaadf4c11e2858e4f

Date:   Tue Nov 26 17:28:18 2019 +0300

commit 9f61ac71250a2d4c1e2cb5d8d5fee7771d65b234
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 26 17:29:22 2019 +0300

    [vcs-log] correctly parse references with parentheses
    
    The list of references for the commit is enclosed in parentheses which are removed as the first step of parsing. But since reference names themselves could contain closing parentheses, the last of them should be removed, not the first one. Removing the first parenthesis results in reference "foo(bar)baz" being parsed as "foo(bar". If there was another reference in the repository named "foo(bar" this could also result in EA-90862.
    
    IDEA-227019
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 23db278628bbae734c99fc2229408df0b1a1b158

commit 42c3f75c718194ab77591a0dd22253d89f2be4b0

commit 2b44936e455c226ef953d3959e521aebe2e5f9f0
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 20 23:25:24 2019 +0300

    [vcs-log] send validate request on data pack arrival for visible log tabs
    
    When a log tab becomes visible, it needs to be validated. If refresh for some roots was postponed, it should be performed prior to validation so that the tab would use the newest data pack.
    
    Previously, tab was not validated when there were postponed roots, which led to it being stuck in the previous state and in need of manual refresh (could be a possible cause of EA-84824). In most cases, refresh is done in background and no roots are postponed, so the issue did not happen, unless "vcs.log.keep.up.to.date" was disabled or the IDE was in power save mode.
    
    In this commit, validation is added on data pack arrival for all visible tabs.
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: bfae995510018d1553e71e5e7ad0a05c2b86baad

commit a3ba3f78fddd5fbe288d300dffa804c26fba2168

commit 67f4f583b7e1c2c12a57e382eefef73a1e8dcdde
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu Oct 17 21:54:03 2019 +0300

    [vcs-log] do not read CommitId during refs query
    
    Refs in the RefsModel are stored by root, so in order to get refs for a specific commit index refsToCommit code used to read CommitId from the storage. refsToCommit is mostly called from EDT, so accessing the storage should be avoided. And since one commit index could only be contained in one CompressedRefs instance, it makes sense to iterate them (if there are not too many of them) and return the data from the first one that contains the specified commit.
    
    EA-214962
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: de3d3b47963d60959584559d646717a4f13eb856

commit e13bfee8fd15e6076853338ce767e9eba7970038
Author: Sergey Malenkov <sergey.malenkov@jetbrains.com>

commit 9667970aaf95d16813103005b4962b4cc9436b0d
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu Jun 20 22:29:28 2019 +0300

    [git] do not create records from incomplete lines
    
    When git command is cancelled, incomplete output is send to the parser, which results in parsing errors. In this case, it's better to skip records with incomplete information altogether.
    
    EA-122540, IDEA-216463
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 8f735b149bdbcf5a862ad38f2ca1f74c5e36317f

commit 3bcb5711f515d43f823a5af5598fa1500fdc0063
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Jun 17 18:45:50 2019 +0300

    [file-history] return correct file path for visible pack with paths information in additional data
    
    When history tab is set invalid, a snapshot visible pack is created to temporary store information. When user switches back to the tab, the snapshot pack is shown until the tab is refreshed. The snapshot has paths information, but it's not an instance of FileHistoryVisiblePack. So a correct FilePath needs to be returned from the ordinary VisiblePack.
    
    EA-145252
    
    GitOrigin-RevId: 3c4fb6711513a38ffa03fb9849b452635aaa71b0

    EA-131153 - INRE: IndexNotReadyException.create

commit 8c52fb894c769e12d85ae29b33590ecdc6337e62
Author: Dmitry Batrak <Dmitry.Batrak@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Wed Feb 13 14:25:25 2019 +0300

    EA-123951 - TDDE: TraceableDisposable.throwDisposalError
    
    This fixes the problem appeared after the fix for CPP-11610 (commit dc782643).
    offset<->logicalPosition conversions cannot be performed for a disposed editor, and we cannot check that editor isn't disposed in a background thread under read action
    without race condition, as editor can be closed without write action. So we'll just avoid performing that conversion in the background thread.

Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 21 22:04:36 2018 +0300

    PY-32827 EA-90746 Fix PIEAE when extracting variable needs post-reformatting
    
    by using smart pointers to preserve references to original elements (occurrences and
    inserted declaration) after PSI trees were merged to reflect the changes.
    
    In such cases after tree merging the assignment containing the usage
    gets deleted altogether (hence PIEAE on the occurrence) and in the assignment
    with declaration both LHS and RHS are replaced so that it effectively becomes
    that assignment with the usage.

commit 123e06e8eff8c4ddea4f6c4b1ae63e545b07953d
Author: Daniil Ovchinnikov <daniil.ovchinnikov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 30 19:16:22 2018 +0300

    [java] don't use toUpperCase() when finding enum constant (IDEA-190718, EA-116115)

commit c4186c3c2978f0365cb07d78861789464e426d21
Author: Kirill Likhodedov <Kirill.Likhodedov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Fri Jul 27 20:04:46 2018 +0300

    Fix a race when searching new hash of the reworded commit
    
    notifySuccess() used to be called before findNewHashOfRewordedCommit.
    Inside of notifySuccess() an asynchronous listener subscribes to repository change events, which checks whether the commit is not published yet (checkUndoPossibility). Thus if this check happened before findNewHashOfRewordedCommit was finished, it threw an exception because new hash was unknown yet.
    
    The fix is to notify success (and subscribe to the listener) after new hash has been found.
    
    Fixes IDEA-196286 and EA-103682, improves the fix for IDEA-193140.

commit d3ecf02165fedc154a3a547f644c087a9f529f17

commit 583f188ef66fa7a31d5179b9cfe4e26c3c70392e
Author: Tagir Valeev <Tagir.Valeev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 12 13:07:16 2018 +0700

    ControlFlowAnalyzer: repeat unboxing for every case label if necessary
    
    Without this it was possible (at least on the incorrect code) that boxed and unboxed classes for the same value get united, which in turn caused repeating entry in DfaMemoryStateImpl#myIdToEqClassesIndices, which could cause NPE when performing successive flush for given variable.
    Now we throw directly at classes unification attempt to catch illegal state earlier
    Fixes EA-118152 - IAE: EqClass.$$$reportNull$$$

commit da2bffad3b0b33e5b40c3c1362cb0ce1d4e7af89
Author: Rustam Vishnyakov <rustam.vishnyakov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu May 24 15:50:23 2018 +0300

    EA-120581 fix

commit 8bf85bb2f4dbcf00ae3664d3438e14395865ef4a
Author: Daniil Ovchinnikov <daniil.ovchinnikov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu May 24 01:28:40 2018 +0300

    [groovy] create code reference directly using the parser
    
    Before the change stubbed references were created from groovy file with
    error check. If a reference contained an error element, the exception
    was thrown. Now references are created using parser directly, they will
    have DummyHolder as a parent, they may contain error elements, but they
    will be well formed meaning that error is reported only in case of
    parser being unable to produce reference tree element instead of relying
    on parsing of some cast expression.
    
    This fixes EA-120589.

commit ae7061523321c0dce9ed0084b8ef03838f2e0c94
Author: Tagir Valeev <Tagir.Valeev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Tue May 22 11:56:09 2018 +0700

    ControlFlowAnalyzer#inlineBlock: remove unnecessary finally
    
    We don't need to restore trap stack if exception occurs: anyways the control flow will be incorrect. With finally ProcessCancelledException may occur at random place and we try to clean up the trap stack creating IllegalStateException which masks the original ProcessCancelledException leading to EA-120375 - ISE: ControlFlowAnalyzer.popTrap
    
    BombedProgressIndicator improved to explode on stack trace condition

    don't invalidate all PSI on root change
    
    It was originally done to avoid UI freeze (IDEA-172762),
    but has led to too many PIEAEs (like IDEA-191185, IDEA-188292, IDEA-184186, EA-114990).
    
    Ideally those clients should all be converted to smart pointers, but that proved to be quite hard to do, especially without breaking API.
    And they mostly worked before those batch invalidations.
    
    So now we have a smarter way of dealing with this issue. On root change, we mark
    PSI as "potentially invalid", and then, when someone calls "isValid"
    (hopefully not for all PSI and hopefully in a background thread),
    we check if the old PSI is equivalent to the one that would be re-created in its place. If yes, we return valid. If no, we invalidate the old PSI forever and return the new one.

commit c4cfcee2514ee3c47317eb19cda3db4c3e738af1
Author: peter <peter@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 10 16:54:29 2018 +0200

    simplify stub-AST-PSI relationships
    
    replace AstPath with index-based SpineRef, take coarser locks, load multi-root stubs independently
    
    What we lose:
    * an ability to gc AST of stubbed PSI loaded via AST-only
    * an ability to gc AST of non-stubbed StubBasedPsiElementBase
    * partial chameleon expansion during findElementAt after AST has been gc-ed but stubbed PSI is still referenced
    ** probably not a major regression: full parsing has been happening during stub-AST switch for ages
    
    What we retain:
    * we can hold references to PSI received from stub index queries without worrying about retaining their AST (even if loaded, it will be gc-ed)
    
    What we gain:
    * simpler code with less mutable state
    * outdated AstPath assertion is now nonexistent (WEB-32120, EA-101911)
    * no more cases when stub has been gc-ed but can't be reloaded due to some cached PSI with unknown stub index (IDEA-189948)
    * other stub-related exceptions are also likely to be fixed:
    ** EA-97101 - REWA: StubBasedPsiElementBase.failedToBindStubToAst
    ** EA-102022 - CCE: PsiFieldImpl.findFirstFieldInDeclaration
    ** EA-101452 - assert: StubBasedPsiElementBase.getRequiredStubOrPsiChild
    ** EA-107208 - ISE: StubBasedPsiElementBase.$$$reportNull$$$
    ** EA-110161 - PIEAE: SubstrateRef$StubRef.reportError
    ** EA-113453 - CCE: PsiClassImpl.getContainingClass
    ** EA-117888 - CCE: PsiClassImpl.getContextStub

commit 36de07bad3d5350bec23cb773e9f10c19a7dd6b5
Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 13 14:35:44 2018 +0300

    EA-116787 Use smart pointer to find and delete original type comment
    
    Because inserting malformed type hint as annotation can alter AST so
    drastically that the original comment becomes invalid. The result of
    the intention is still syntactically illegal but at least we don't throw
    exceptions anymore.
    
    Attempting to parse every single type comment to check its validity
    seems somewhat wasteful. We'd better come up with a decent heuristic for
    that purpose.
    
    The original case for a type comment combining type hint with subsequent
    plain text part has been already handled thanks to changes for
    PY-21195, as we stopped inserting these trailing comments in annotations
    themselves, but I added a test for it just in case.

commit 0ec01844769602a10c0f73b9e59c6c8b5747070f
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Dec 11 22:34:06 2017 +0300

    EA-114075

commit 2cff101b57c33134a420d5505ba5cf5ce68f2bcd
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Dec 11 22:21:22 2017 +0300

    [git] stop process that refuses to be softly killed
    
    Since a program can ignore SIGINT signal, a SIGKILL signal should be sent afterwards if it does so.
    In order to do this properly, reuse ExecutionManagerImpl.stopProcess method that either kills process or destroys/detaches from it.
    
    Example when SIGINT is ignored by child processes (on unix): IDEA-157989.
    
    EA-114075

commit 87359e75828d77823dea79a2f62524d87178c010
Author: peter <peter@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Nov 20 09:55:55 2017 +0100

    fix a bearded LazyParseableElement.ensureParsed race
    
    myParsed should be set to true only after PSI tree is fully updated,
    but previously it wasn't so, and another thread
    could see semi-consistent state (EA-108900 - NPE: CompositeElement.drillDown)
    
    the PSI change should be transparent and atomic, not being interrupted by
    any exceptions. Now there's an assertion for that.
    
    AstPath should also be updated before myParsed releases the state
    to other threads: this race could possibly also be a cause of EA-101911 - assert: AstPath$ChildPath.reportMissingChildren

commit ba5d32a3f8566571885b3ad8a7858d25a0490ffd
Author: Kirill Likhodedov <Kirill.Likhodedov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Tue Oct 17 17:36:29 2017 +0300

    Fix VFS events processing in GitUntrackedFilesHolder
    
    event.isValid() check, which was added in 816f311 to avoid EA-109103, was incorrect:
    VFileCreateEvent treats event as not valid if the file already exists,
    and it almost always already exists because events are process async.
    
    Because of this, VFileCreateEvents were simply ignored: IDEA-180605.
    
    isValid() check is reverted, and EA-109103 is fixed the other way:
    by manually checking if the parent is valid.

commit 5b9c94fa3ea2428b3cea4ce8680b03d037d8955d
Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 2 16:24:52 2017 +0300

    PY-26298 EA-107209 Return empty list in case of exception instead of null
    
    It's not the best idea to suppress exceptions (logged) like that, but
    PyPackageManager itself works this way at the moment by caching an empty
    list of packages after the first error. It also releases the clients of
    refreshAndGetPackages() of burden of handling these (presumably rare)
    exceptions on their own.

Author: Kirill Likhodedov <Kirill.Likhodedov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Sun Sep 17 10:40:42 2017 +0300

    Register disposable in a read action EA-107471
    
    This allows to avoid IOE if the parent has already been disposed.
    
    Works only for disposables which are disposed in a write action,
    but that's the majority. The rest can still get IOE which is logged
    for statistical reasons.
    
    Follow-up to 1b32242.

    [vcs-log] properly close merged together tabs

commit 25b35c24396ce5740e52730dd619136a28a60681
Author: Mikhail Golubev <mikhail.golubev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 26 22:20:55 2017 +0300

    EA-75072 Fix ISE when bad indent makes inserted docstring split function body
    
    Specifically, it may cause shift of the inserted docstring (and the
    following statement) relative to the rest of the function body thus
    fragmenting its block structure.
    CodeInsightUtilCore.forcePsiPostprocessAndRestoreElement() can no longer
    find PyFunction element at the updated range and, thus, buildAndInsert()
    returns illegal null value.
    
    Now we use the actual indentation of a function's body both when it's
    larger than what is configured in the code style settings
    (PyIntentionTest.testTypeInDocstring3) and when it's smaller
    (PyIntentionTest.testGoogleDocStubCustomIndent) and operate solely
    on the document's level in case of new docstrings to avoid
    unwanted postprocess reformatting.
    
    I also updated some of the existing test data so that it could reproduce
    the problem by including more than one statement in a function's body.

commit 733b35ba6dde605903bef67ca3ae2e1070c361a3
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 17 22:11:07 2017 +0300

    [git] skip replaced in commit references list
    
    Similar to grafted commits, replaced commits are marked as "replaced". Since this is not a reference, it is not included in references list.
    
    IDEA-169831, EA-99213

commit df80a4a01adb13aca1f9f6dd7faf1ba88692a0eb
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 17 21:49:40 2017 +0300

    [git] skip grafted in commit references list
    
    When git repository has grafted commits, or is a shallow clone, commits with rewritten parents have "grafted" marker. It is shown with the list of references for the commit in log, but this is not a reference. Since creating a "grafted" reference leads to exceptions (having several references with the same name but a different hash is rather unexpected), this commit skips "grafted" markers entirely.
    
    IDEA-169831, EA-99213

    in PyCharm projects which settings have been corrupted for some reason.
    DocStringFormat.PLAIN is used in some cases as a fallback format.

Author: Rustam Vishnyakov <rustam.vishnyakov@jetbrains.com>

    EA-82793 Fix

commit 4a147effb9156a26020006ce66b6087a5d6793b2
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 17 01:58:27 2016 +0300

    [git] fix parsing commits with \u0001 symbol in commit message
    
    In order to separate a commit record, find "record end" symbol first. After this, find the beginning of the next record ("record start" symbol). This helps with commit messages containing "record start" (\u0001 used for that), since "record start" in the message is not treated now as a beginning of a new record.
    
    This fixes EA-90019.

commit b46fc65439d1fecbfe1070f532bb90d10f6fc761
Author: Julia Beliaeva <Julia.Beliaeva@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Fri Jul 1 20:16:55 2016 +0300

    [hg] mercurial reference comparator works better for references in different roots
    
    Comparator can be given references from two different vcs rooots, which means two separate "default" branches. This could lead to ambiguous results, since the old code did not expect that. So, check if name is the same first, only then check if one reference is a default branch.
    (Possible fix for EA-75749)

Author: Max Medvedev <maxim.medvedev@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 3 17:03:03 2014 +0400

    EA-53171
    Extracted a separate class for caching type definition stuff. Used CachedValueManager for caching class members, caches depends on its type definition changes and out_of_code_block_modification due to many synthetic members of a class get invalidated independently from its class.

commit e39383e90156e54ef3a4f97f9ae3d4663109e33c
Author: Denis Zhdanov <Denis.Zhdanov@jetbrains.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 2 16:52:21 2010 +0300

    EA-22743 - assert: AbstractMappingStrategy.processFoldRegion
    
    1. Soft wraps cache doesn't use standalone map for storing fold data anymore. That data is stored at the cache itself instead and that eliminates possibility of the data be become out of date;
    2. Soft wrap cache update events are stored at object of the dedicated class now. The main point is to move there functionality of events sorting and merging. Corresponding unit test is added;
    3. Document listener priorities are changed in order to update range markers before soft wraps. That allows to detect that fold region data is outdated during soft wraps processing;
